definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: It didn't reach required standards of safety and seaworthiness.
sentences.chinese: 它沒有達到安全性和適航性的規定標準。

sentences.english: Thus your ship is unseaworthy, and she will be detained in our port.
sentences.chinese: 所以你的船是不適航的，將會在本港被滯留。
有關適航性的警告性備忘錄。

sentences.english: Preparation of service information in coordination with the Airworthiness Department.
sentences.chinese: 配合適航部門準備服務信息。

sentences.english: In charge of organizing and carrying out aero-products' airworthiness certification and management.
sentences.chinese: 負責組織實施公司航空產品的適航審定與管理工作。

sentences.english: Liability for seaworthiness is one of"least legal obligations"of carriers.
sentences.chinese: 適航責任爲承運人的“最低法定義務”之一。

sentences.english: Service information and Instructions for Continued Airworthiness.
sentences.chinese: 服務信息和持續適航文件。

sentences.english: Airworthiness approval as long as the Government, I would dare to try.
sentences.chinese: 只要政府適航部門批准，我就敢嘗試。

sentences.english: This wing could easily be returned to airworthy status by replacing the lower lines.
sentences.chinese: 這隻翅膀很容易返回到適航狀態下通過更換線路。

sentences.english: Aircraft built in accordance with this certification regulation are to receive an airworthiness certification.
sentences.chinese: 按照這一認證法規制造的飛機將可以收到適航認證。

sentences.english: To monitor and certify work is in compliance with airworthiness and company requirements.
sentences.chinese: 監督和確保工作與適航和公司要求相一致。

sentences.english: At the time of delivery, the shipowner shall exercise due diligence to make the ship seaworthy.
sentences.chinese: 交船時，出租人應當做到謹慎處理，使船舶適航。

sentences.english: In charge of aero-products related airworthiness certification affairs.
sentences.chinese: 負責公司航空產品適航審定事務。

sentences.english: The influence of various parameters of planing boat on rapidity and navigability is also analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析了滑行艇諸要素對其快速性及適航性的影響。

sentences.english: Ship working violently and secured movable things for seaworthiness.
sentences.chinese: 船強烈顛簸，爲適航性固定了可移動的物件。
